page.title: 02INDUSTRY
page.content: The farms in this area are all rented. They mainly breed beef cattle ( Friesian / Hereford and Friesian /Aberdeen Angus ).and sheep ( Scottish Black Face or Black Face /Border Leicester). Lambs are taken to market when about 8 months old. When shorn, the wool is used for carpets etc. There is a tannery a few miles from Kildrummy where sheepskin goods can be bought. The main market for both cattle and sheep is Alford, but some beast are taken to Aberdeen. The grain grown on the farm is mainly for cattle feed but recently farmers have been growing winter barley and if suitable is used for making whisky. Some farmers breed pig and poultry on a small scale.
